<!DOCTYPE html><html lang="en"><script id="gtm">
          performance.mark('gtm.start');
          (function (w, d, s, l, i) {
            w[l] = w[l] || [];
            w[l].push({ 'gtm.start': new Date().getTime(), event: 'gtm.js' });
            var f = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0],
                j = d.createElement(s),
                dl = l != 'dataLayer' ? '&l=' + l : '';
            j.async = true;
            j.src = 'https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtm.js?id=' + i + dl;
            j.onload = function () {
              performance.mark('gtm.end');
              performance.measure('gtm', 'gtm.start', 'gtm.end');
            };
            f.parentNode.insertBefore(j, f);
        })(window, document, 'script', 'dataLayer', 'GTM-M36RG8PT');
        </script><head><meta charSet="utf-8"/><meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width"/><link rel="shortcut icon" href="https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/favicon.7bc3d920.ico"/><script>
      try {
        window.eventsToSend = window.eventsToSend || []
        window.eventsToSend.push({
          name: "page_rendering",
          timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
          value: JSON.stringify({
            time: performance?.now()
          })
        })
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Failed to push page render event:", error)
      }

class="metadata Metadata_root__EZem9" data-cy="metadata"><h1 class="title Metadata_title__aM3nZ Heading_h1__jLBB4 Heading_heading___M8rU">BlueHat v17 || 10 Years of Targeted Credential Phishing | Billy Leonard </h1><div class="stats Stats_root__p_BoZ"><span class="text Text_root__RtCPC Text_medium__TH6gG Text_secondary__o6d_E Likes_root__WVQ1_" style="-webkit-line-clamp:0" tabindex="0">1 like</span><span class="Stats_bullet__DbT30"></span><span class="text Text_root__RtCPC Text_medium__TH6gG Text_secondary__o6d_E Likes_root__WVQ1_" style="-webkit-line-clamp:0" tabindex="0">800<!-- --> <!-- -->views</span><button type="button" class="ai-tag unstyled-button AITag_tag__Xx37c" data-cy="ai-tag" aria-describedby="aiTag-description" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R3497d6:" description</button><div class="" id=":R3497d6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R3497d6"></div></div><div class="author Author_root___6Bx5"><a data-cy="author-link" class="Author_link___lVxw ellipsis" title="BlueHat Security Conference" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MSbluehat"><div class="Avatar_root__GNWHY" style="width:24px;height:24px;line-height:24px"><img class="Avatar_image__Bbtll" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/profile-photo-MSbluehat-48x48.jpg?cb=1575402763" alt="BlueHat Security Conference" loading="lazy" decoding="sync"/></div><span>BlueHat Security Conference</span></a></div><div class="description Description_root__kt4uq Description_clamped__PaV_1"><div class="Description_wrapper__hYE9_"><p data-cy="document-description">The document presents a comprehensive analysis of targeted credential phishing threats over the past decade, detailing the evolution of attack methods and defenses. It highlights crucial developments like SMS interception, two-factor authentication vulnerabilities, and the importance of security keys and OAuth. The report outlines various actors involved in these attacks and suggests enhanced protective measures to combat ongoing threats.</p><div class="pills-list PillsList_root__2EydN"><a class="Pill_root__IqOYH" aria-label="View the featured presentations, documents and infographics in the Technology Category" href="https://www.slideshare.net/category/technology"><span class="icon class="vertical-player VerticalPlayer_root__K8_YS" data-slideshow-id="83684578"><div><div id="slide1" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:720 / 405" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-0" alt="Threat Analysis Group
November 2017 - @billyleonard
10 Years of Targeted Credential Phishing
 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="high" loading="eager" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-1-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-1-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/75/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-1-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-1-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide2" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:720 / 405" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-1" alt="Threat Analysis Group
Billy Leonard
Threat Analysis Group
 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-2-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-2-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/75/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-2-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-2-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide3" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:720 / 405" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-2" alt="Threat Analysis Group
But first, ….
 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-3-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-3-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/75/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-3-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-3-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide4" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:720 / 405" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-3" alt="Threat Analysis Group
What we don&#x27;t see in targeted phishing.
 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-4-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-4-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/75/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-4-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-4-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide5" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:720 / 405" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-4" alt="Threat Analysis Group
 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-5-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-5-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/75/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-5-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-5-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide6" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:720 / 405" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-5" alt="Threat Analysis Group
Targeted attacks are all really advanced.
 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-6-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-6-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/75/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-6-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-6-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide7" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:720 / 405" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-6" alt="Threat Analysis Group

The Middle Ages.

Password Alert.
 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-19-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-19-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/75/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-19-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-19-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide20" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:720 / 405" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-19" alt="Threat Analysis Group

Two Factor Bypass.
 " class="vertical-slide-image VerticalSlideImage_image__VtE4p" data-testid="vertical-slide-image" fetchpriority="auto" loading="lazy" srcSet="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-21-320.jpg 320w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-21-638.jpg 638w, https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/75/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-21-2048.jpg 2048w" src="https://image.slidesharecdn.com/copyof10yearsoftargetedcredentialphishing-msftfinal-171209002251/85/BlueHat-v17-10-Years-of-Targeted-Credential-Phishing-Billy-Leonard-21-320.jpg" sizes="100vw"/></div><!--$--><!--/$--></div></div><div><div id="slide22" class="VerticalSlide_root__jU_9r slide-item" style="aspect-ratio:720 / 405" data-cy="slide-container"><div class="VerticalSlideImage_root__64KSA"><img id="slide-image-21" alt="Threat Analysis Group
Source: https://breakingdefense.com/2015/06/strike-back-at-chinese-for-opm-hack-build-a-cyber-strategy/,

SMS Interception.

10 Years of Targeted Credential Phishing

Threat Analysis Group

What </a> we don&#x27;t see in targeted phishing.

Two </a> Factor Bypass.
 </li></div><div><li>22. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/10-years-of-targeted-credential-phishing-billy-leonard/83684578#22">Threat Analysis Group
Source: </a> https://breakingdefense.com/2015/06/strike-back-at-chinese-for-opm-hack-build-a-cyber-strategy/,
http://www.seleniumhq.org/, http://phantomjs.org/
 </li></div><div><li>23. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/10-years-of-targeted-credential-phishing-billy-leonard/83684578#23">Threat Analysis Group
SMS </a> Interception.
 </li></div><div><li>24. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/10-years-of-targeted-credential-phishing-billy-leonard/83684578#24">Threat Analysis Group
 </a> </li></div><div><li>25. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/10-years-of-targeted-credential-phishing-billy-leonard/83684578#25">Threat Analysis Group </a> Source: https://techcrunch.com/2016/07/25/nist-declares-the-age-of-sms-based-2-factor-authentication-over/,
https://www.wired.com/2016/06/hey-stop-using-texts-two-factor-authentication/,
https://www.howtogeek.com/310418/why-you-shouldnt-use-sms-for-two-factor-authentication/
 </li></div><div><li>26. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/10-years-of-targeted-credential-phishing-billy-leonard/83684578#26">Threat Analysis Group
Source: </a> https://www.fredericjacobs.com/blog/2016/01/14/sms-login/, https://www.fredericjacobs.com/blog/2016/04/30/more-on-sms-logins/
 </li></div><div><li>27. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/10-years-of-targeted-credential-phishing-billy-leonard/83684578#27">Threat Analysis Group
Source: </a> https://www.fredericjacobs.com/blog/2016/04/30/more-on-sms-logins/
 </li></div><div><li>28. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/10-years-of-targeted-credential-phishing-billy-leonard/83684578#28">Threat Analysis Group
Security </a> Keys.
 </li></div><div><li>29. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/10-years-of-targeted-credential-phishing-billy-leonard/83684578#29">Threat Analysis Group

OAuth.
 </a> </li></div><div><li>31. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/10-years-of-targeted-credential-phishing-billy-leonard/83684578#31">Threat Analysis Group

The report is based on scan data from over 85,000 applications assessed between April 2018 and March 2019. Key findings include: (1) Most security flaws are eventually fixed but fix times have remained consistent, (2) The likelihood of flaws being fixed decreases over time leading to growing \"security debt\", (3) Frequent scanning correlated with faster fix times and lower security debt indicating the benefits of DevSecOps practices. It explains that syzkaller sprays large allocations across memory pages to leave small holes, then sprays the targeted object to fill one of the holes and have the target in front of the spray. Using Feature Manipulation Engine (FME) tools—FME Flow and Workbench—sensor data is automatically processed, validated, and integrated into a centralized dashboard built with ArcGIS Online (AGOL). FME Flow automates workflows, including real-time data aggregation and regulatory alerts. When first introduced to FME Form (nee’ Workbench), I was immediately inspired to use it for this purpose. To create a Revit model in the conventional way, it takes several months and hundreds of thousands of dollars to create a medium-sized office building. For many public and private sector institutions charged with building and maintaining real estate assets, this is a deal breaker, or at the very least, a long, expensive effort. The goal is not to make a highly detailed LOD 400 federated Revit model, but rather a geometrically correct ‘lighter’ version that can be used for future projects and attain the ‘critical mass’ needed to start a BIM program. Having one or two conventional models out of many buildings will not achieve that, interest will wane, and the expensive models will soon be out of date. I will be demonstrating my workflow to generate LOD 200 Revit models from CAD files and a few other data sources using CAD, FME and pyRevit. The majority of the work is on the CAD side, with FME interpreting the files into data used by a custom pyRevit extension in Revit. Like the movie Dodgeball, I had naysayers, uninterested users, many technical challenges, and a well-resourced competition that were dismissive of my scrappy, outside-the-box methods. This has been a 4 year long journey so far and is still evolving, but there has been redemption as others have seen my process in action. I think you will be entertained!","tags":[],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/my-journey-from-cad-to-bim-a-true-underdog-story/280967759","userLogin":"SafeSoftware","userName":"Safe Software","viewCount":51},{"algorithmId":"4","displayTitle":"Plugging AI into everything: Model Context Protocol Simplified.pdf","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":32,"score":0,"slideshowId":"280892214","sourceName":"LATEST","strippedTitle":"plugging-ai-into-everything-model-context-protocol-simplified-pdf","extension":"pdf","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/pluggingaiintoeverythingmodelcontextprotocolsimplified-250622222646-c5f235c2-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"When APIs first came into the mix, they opened up the world to unlimited possibilities - applications could speak to each other, exchanging data, creating new and custom interfaces and much more. There are multiple components that all have to be installed in the correct way, and a shared disk that needs to be set up and mounted on all machines with the right permissions. We have simplified all of this with our Infrastructure as Code templates which users can use to create their own FME images in the cloud, and deploy using our Terraform templates. Using Packer and Terraform, this complicated deployment becomes something that is much simpler. It can also be automated using pipelines. It is also much more easily reproducible which allows for easily deployment into a staging environment as well as a production environment. Through this automation, Portland Public Schools achieved an 80% reduction in data update time and a significant improvement in data accuracy. The remote/local (\"remocal\") development workflow, enabled by mirrord, addresses these issues by allowing developers to run their code locally while seamlessly intercepting traffic and accessing remote resources running in the cluster. This removes the need for heavyweight local setups, reduces CI bottlenecks, and simplifies the development workflow.\n\nIn this talk, we’ll cover:\n\nThe remocal development workflow mirrord introduces, the challenges it solves, and how it simplifies cloud-native development.\n\nA deep dive into the technical implementation of mirrord—how it overrides local syscalls to trick a local process into \"thinking\" it's running in the Kubernetes cluster.\n\nA hands-on demo showing mirrord in action, demonstrating how it makes debugging and developing against a real cloud environment easier without running your entire stack on your laptop.\n\nBy the end, you'll have a new, practical approach to developing in the cloud in a faster, easier, and cheaper way.\n\nEyal Bukchin is the CTO and co-founder of MetalBear, the company behind mirrord, an open-source tool that lets developers run their code locally while connected to a remote Kubernetes environment. With years of experience in infrastructure and Kubernetes, Eyal is focused on simplifying cloud-native development. We’ll explore the key choices for designing an FME Flow architecture that fits your IT landscape, integrates smoothly, ensures security, flexibility, and supports future growth. We'll also address practical questions like: should it be fault-tolerant? Is a single server enough, or do you need a distributed setup? What about infrastructure—cloud, on-premises, or hybrid? And for engines, should they be remote or distributed? This presentation will outline how 1Spatial collaborated with Hunter Water in their ArcGIS Utility Network (UN) Migration as part of their GIS Transformation Project. This project allowed Hunter Water to leverage the latest digital geospatial technologies to visualise and analyse their networks and assets. Validation of the data being loaded into the new GIS platforms was completed using 1Spatial's skills and technologies. Under this partnership, Hunter Water leveraged 1Spatial's expertise and technology in the cloud to streamline its data migration process, ensuring the efficient transfer of critical information for its operations. This strategic move aligned with Hunter Water’s commitment to delivering the highest quality water and wastewater services to its customers across the Lower Hunter region. This presentation will detail the issues encountered by Hunter Water in their project of migrating their existing system to the new ArcGIS Utility Network.
